text: George Hidipo Hamba Kambala (born 9 May 1992) is a Namibian youth activist who along with Job Amupanda and Dimbulukeni Nauyoma, he co-Founded a radical youth movement known as the Affirmative Repositioning Movement in 2014.https://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?id=131571&page;=archive-read | Affirmative Repositioning â€“ The Rationale - The Namibianhttps://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?page=archive-read&id;=144771 | Affirmative Repositioning: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly - The Namibianhttp://namibtimes.net/swapo-vs-affirmative-repositioning-movement | Swapo vs Affirmative Repositioning Movement | Namib Timeshttps://www.enca.com/africa/namibias-ruling-party-act-urban-land-shortage| Swapo to act on urban land shortagehttps://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?id=131553&page;=archive-read | 'Affirmative repositioning' responses ready - The Namibian == Personal life == Kambala was born and grew up in Windhoek's Katutura where he attended Martti Ahtisaari Primary School. He was part of the SWAPO Party Youth League leaders who were suspended and expelled from the party for occupying a plot in an upmarket Windhoek suburb.https://www.lelamobile.com/content/40527/Job-three-suspended-from-Swapo | Lela Mobile Online - Job-three suspended from Swapohttp://www.observer.com.na/index.php/sports/item/5710-swapo-draws-heavy-fire-in-high-court-battle | Swapo draws heavy fire in High Court battle - Windhoek Observer == Affirmative Repositioning Movement Activism == Following reports that Windhoek Mayor Agnes Kafula allocated a plot to a Big Brother Africa winner, Kambala alongside Nauyoma and Amupanda occupied land in a Windhoek suburb to raise more concerns on the land question in Namibia.https://www.newera.com.na/2014/11/10/amupanda-initiates-land-grab | Amupanda initiates land grab | New Era Newspaper Namibiahttp://www.observer.com.na/index.php/component/content/article/12-opinions-analysis/5431-talking-about-revolution| Windhoek Observer - Windhoek Observer == References == Category:People from Windhoek Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Namibian activists Category:Youth activists
title: George Kambala
